config_description: Compression to apply to the hint files. If omitted, hints files will be written uncompressed. LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'hints_compression' is used to specify the compression to apply to the hint files. If the compressionConfig is not null, the compression parameters are retrieved and added to the builder as compressorParams. Finally, the compression parameters are added to the builder as HintsDescriptor.COMPRESSION.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'hints_compression' configuration depends on when the DatabaseDescriptor.getHintsCompression() method is called. This could vary depending on the specific use case and how often hint files are being written or read in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'hints_compression' configuration option on the system is related to the size of the hint files. If compression is applied, the hint files will take up less disk space but may require additional CPU resources for compression and decompression operations. Different compressors like LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate have different trade-offs in terms of compression ratio and CPU usage.
